The Radio Risaia Sud artistically born in 1996 with the musicians of "Mancastroppa Band" , currently Doctor Groove.
 They record a demo tape in the studios of Beppe Crovella , with the collaboration of Cesare Petrelli as an arranger and musician.
 The pieces are in the dialect of Vercelli and talk about the characters, sayings and stories related to the territory.
 The music matched the lyrics are popular matrix ranging from blues to reggae to ballads.
 
 The band's first outing was at the legendary "Folk Club" in Turin, local where they performed the greatest artists of the genre folk and ethnic . The public response was motivated to write more pieces until you reach all 20 tracks inspired by folk tales . Lately they are working on a new CD with unreleased material.
 
 The Radio Paddy Field South have entered from the initial training Marco Berri Sandro Marinoni on bass and sax.
 The last concerts were held at the Civic Theatre of Vercelli and in the deconsecrated church of San Germano Vercelli.
 
 The training is now :
 
 Silvano Coggiola : vocals and guitar
 Roberto Ceresa : guitar
 Marco Berri : bass
 Sandro Marinoni : sax
 Vescovo Luciano : drums
